title: Wolfram Demonstrations Project
summary: The Wolfram Demonstrations Project is an organized, open-source collection of small (or medium-sized) interactive programmes called Demonstrations, which are meant to visually and interactively represent ideas from a range of fields. It is hosted by Wolfram Research, whose stated goal is to bring computational exploration to a large population. At its launch, it contained 1300 demonstrations but has grown to over 10,000. The site won a Parents' Choice Award in 2008.
